DATA SCIENTIST  Role Summary  This role will work hand-in-hand with executive leadership and various other business leaders to accomplish project goals and fulfill all external and internal customer needs in alignment with enterprise digitalization efforts. The Data Scientist will operate with fast pace and perspective to further develop skills and enhance their own leadership capability. They will be expected to operate independently and add value by jumping into existing project work, while also developing a plan to gain exposure to different aspects of Pilot’s business and manufacturing practices.  Key Responsibilities  Business and Data Analysis  Help maintain existing reporting solutions as well as create additional sustainable reporting as required by projects or end users primarily within Power BI  Define requirements for raw data collection, processing, and staging as necessary for reporting solutions.  Leverage your experience in analytics tools (R, Python, etc.) and scientific rigor to produce actionable insights.  Conduct and / or coordinate financial, product, market, operational and related research to support strategic and business planning within digitalization team.  Interpret, evaluate, and present findings from data for incorporation into overall digitalization roadmap.  Suggest process changes to executive leadership using analytics to support your recommendations.  Conduct insightful, ad hoc analyses to investigate ongoing or one-time operational issues.  Business Understanding and Project Management  Understand operational and strategic business objectives by studying business functions, documenting business requirements, and end user needs.  Construct workflow charts and diagrams as needed for system capabilities analysis and data flows.  Define project requirements by identifying project milestones, phases, and elements.  Execute project plan, report progress, identify and resolve problems, and recommend further actions.  Identify additional digitalization opportunities as a result of completed project work.  Competencies  Required:  Bachelor’s degree in an analytics-based major such as statistics, business analytics, information systems, or computer science  High proficiency in all standard Microsoft products such as Word, Excel, Visio, PowerPoint, and Outlook  High proficiency in data visualization platforms such as Microsoft Power BI  Proficiency in data management and querying via SQL  Proficiency or in at least one analytical programming languages such as R or Python  Experience with Machine Learning techniques (ex. Clustering, regression analysis, etc.)  Experience (professional or academic) managing projects to deliver results on time and within budget.    Good command of soft skills including:  Possessing top-notch interpersonal skills  Exhibiting a professional demeanor  Is self-motivated and disciplined  Displays superior critical thinking and problem-solving abilities  Can balance attention to detail without losing sight of the big picture  Results driven while acting as an agent of change  Recommended:  Master’s degree in an analytics-based major statistics, business analytics, information systems, or computer science  Greater than 5 years’ experience in a similar role with additional education post BS as substitute work experience  Experience working within chemical manufacturing industry  Proficiency or exposure to other development languages such as Lua, Java, or C++   Pilot Chemical is an equal opportunity employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills, and experiences within our workforce. All employment is decided based on qualifications, merit, and business need.  Join our growing team!

Description   POSITION TITLE:  Artificial Intelligence Post-doctoral Research Fellow   SUBFUNCTION DEFINITION:  To conduct scientific studies related to medical image using artificial intelligence approaches.   CAREER LEVEL SUMMARY:  Dr. Lili He's laboratory of Artificial Intelligence for Computer Aided Diagnosis (AI-CAD) at Imaging Research Center (IRC) is committed to lending the group's interdisciplinary expertise in computer science, medical imaging, biomedical engineering and biostatistics to facilitate major breakthroughs in the medical AI field by developing and validating robust clinically effective AI diagnostic tools for clinicians to use at the bedside to improve diagnosis, prediction, and prevention of patient outcomes for high-risk infants and children. We are now looking for talented and highly-motivated AI post-doctoral research fellows to join us. Applicants should email their CV, along with a brief letter outlining their AI/research background and interests to Hailong Li (Hailong.Li@cchmc.org).   Cincinnati Children's Hospital Medical Center  is a premier  pediatric research institution  with over 900 diverse and productive faculty members. Here, researchers work collaboratively across specialties and divisions to address some of the biggest challenges we face today in improving child health. A strong network of research support  services  and  facilities , along with institutional commitment to research, push our team of faculty, postdocs and support staff to explore the boundaries of what is possible, leading to  significant breakthroughs . We are driven by our mission to improve child health and transform the delivery of care through fully integrated, globally recognized research, education and innovation.  Post-doctoral research fellows at Cincinnati Children's are valued for their unique interests and strengths, and are supported by our institution's  strong programming for post-docs  through the  Office of Postdoctoral Affairs  and the  Office of Academic Affairs and Career Development . Mentoring,  support for international students  and an emphasis on crafting high-quality grant proposals are only a few of the  features that set our program apart . Cincinnati Children's is a respected part of the broader, and very vibrant, Cincinnati community. With a thriving arts scene, numerous festivals celebrating music and food, a passionate fan following for our college and professional sports teams, and a variety of opportunities for outdoor activities,  our region is truly a great place to work and live .   REPRESENTATIVE RESPONSIBILITIES:  SCOPE: Development and implementation of AI techniques, medical image/data analysis.   Representative Responsibilities  Design, develop, and implement state-of-the-art AI techniques; reproduce and apply existing algorithms/methods/models for medical applications. Innovate and advance AI techniques; evaluate and improve AI algorithms/methods/models currently used. Establish and validate algorithms/methods/models to create clinically meaningful AI tools that involve medical images.  Assist with image data curation, processing, and analysis.  Communicate results/findings; draft and edit scientific abstracts, presentations, and journal articles. Present work at workshops, seminars, and conference proceedings within and outside of CCHMC.    Qualifications   Education/Experience:  PhD degree in computer science, biomedical engineering, bioinformatics, electrical engineering, or related field.   Required:   Extensive experience in machine learning and deep learning development using Scikit-learn, deep learning package (e.g., Tensorflow, Keras, PyTorch).  Strong communication skills in written and verbal English, and ability to work both independently and as a team member to accomplish core objectives.    Preferred:   Medical image research experience. Biomedical statistical analysis experience.  Strong programming skills with Linux-based Python and familiarity with containerization.  Multiprocessing experience using GPUs for training and inference.

Company Profile Want to help save lives, creating cutting-edge technology that enables clinicians to detect lung disease as early and accurately as possible? Excited about AI and Machine Learning?  Our world-class team has developed a revolutionary and proprietary AI/ML medical imaging software that has made our Dayton, OH based company a leader in this rapidly developing industry. We recently received sizeable external funding to help us take our mission and life-saving products to the next level, and are rapidly growing the team!  If you have experience in image analysis and are passionate about the medical field, we'd love to speak with you!  Position Overview You will be working with a top-notch team of like-skilled professionals to productize research, release products and support customers. You will be utilizing and enhancing design tools and practices, and counted on to deliver quality, timely solutions to support company needs.  What will you be doing  Investigate, design and implement advanced image analysis and machine learning methods  Design and implement production ready machine learning and image analysis pipelines  Design and transition product prototypes to high-performance, scalable production models  Write and publish technical documents that capture conducted research  Work alongside the Research and Development Team  Work alongside the Regulatory Affairs and Quality Assurance team   What you will need to be successful  3+ years' experience in product-oriented software development environment, or equivalent.  Experience in image analysis/processing, computer vision, machine learning, or equivalent.  BSc or MS in Computer Science, Biomedical Engineering or similar related scientific field.  Strong mathematical background; advanced programming skills with expertise in Matlab, Python and C/C++  Experience in training large scale models using modern machine learning frameworks for deep learning and image analysis with tools such as Tensorflow, Keras and PyTorch  Strong initiative and collaboration skills to work in a team.  Experience in a regulated environment or machine learning development is a significant advantage.  Familiarity with applied deep learning to vision problems is a significant advantage.

Company Description    Verisk 3E delivers intelligent compliance solutions that empower companies around the globe to reduce risk, drive continuous improvement and create new growth opportunities. Verisk 3E has set the standard for combining regulatory expertise and enriched global compliance content and transforming it into actionable intelligence to enhance chemical and workplace safety, product safety and stewardship, supply chain stewardship and research and development support. Together, with our customers, we are working to make the world safer—one product, one workplace and one community at a time. To learn more visit www.verisk3e.com We are proud to be a part of the Verisk family of companies!     At the heart of what we do is help clients manage risk. Verisk (Nasdaq: VRSK) provides data and insights to our customers in insurance, energy and the financial services markets so they can make faster and more informed decisions.     Our global team uses AI, machine learning, automation, and other emerging technologies to collect and analyze billions of records. We provide advanced decision-support to prevent credit, lending, and cyber risks. In addition, we monitor and advise companies on complex global matters such as climate change, catastrophes, and geopolitical issues.     But why we do our work is what sets us apart. It stems from a commitment to making the world better, safer and stronger.     It’s the reason Verisk is part of the UN Global Compact sustainability initiative. It’s why we made a commitment to balancing 100 percent of our carbon emissions. It’s the aim of our “returnship” program for experienced professionals rejoining the workforce after time away. And, it’s what drives our annual Innovation Day, where we identify our next first-to-market innovations to solve our customers’ problems.     At its core, Verisk uses data to minimize risk and maximize value. But far bigger, is why we do what we do.     At Verisk you can build an exciting career with meaningful work; create positive and lasting impact on business; and find the support, coaching, and training you need to advance your career. We have received the Great Place to Work® Certification for the fifth consecutive year. We’ve been recognized by  Forbes  as a World’s Best Employer and a Best Employer for Women, testaments to our culture of engagement and the value we place on an inclusive and diverse workforce. Verisk’s Statement on Racial Equity and Diversity supports our commitment to these values and affecting positive and lasting change in the communities where we live and work.           Job Description    Verisk 3E is looking for a SQL Developer to join the team. We are open to this role working a hybrid in office with remote flexibility from our Canton, OH location or if not local, fully remote caniddates will be considered in the US.         Provide technical application development and quality assurance effort in the completion of basic project tasks as described on the work requests written in support of the project.      Develop detailed programming logic, test and troubleshoot programs utilizing the appropriate hardware, database, and programming technology. Refine and format final product.      Performs analysis and design of complex client configuration requests for Verisk 3E’s 3E Generate product.      Provide second level technical support for 3E Generate and 3E Notify. In addition, provided first level technical support for other Verisk 3E solution including but not limited to 3E ERC and 3E Optimize      Develop, maintain and update technical documentation such as system configurations, procedures, problem fixes, and client support procedures.      Develop updates and distribute user instructional documentation as needed.      Completes all responsibilities as outlined on annual Performance Plan.      Completes all special projects and other duties as assigned.      Must be able to perform duties with or without reasonable accommodation.              Qualifications            Associates Degree required, Bachelor’s degree preferred in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent work experience.      3+ years of progressively responsible related experience in an information technology position.      In-depth working knowledge of the SQL language, PowerBuilder, RDBMS in general, and either MS SQL Server or Oracle.      Foundational knowledge of SAP / SAP EHS module preferred      Experience in an Agile development environment preferred.      Ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing; superior customer service skills.      Ability to work independently and as part of a team; excellent time management and organizational skills.        #LI-SH1     Additional Information    Verisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer.     All members of the Verisk Analytics family of companies are equal opportunity employers. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, veteran's status, age or disability.  http://www.verisk.com/careers.html     Unsolicited resumes sent to Verisk, including unsolicited resumes sent to a Verisk business mailing address, fax machine or email address, or directly to Verisk employees, will be considered Verisk property. Verisk will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume.     Consumer Privacy Notice     At Verisk, the health and safety of our people is our number one priority.  Effective November 15, 2021, and subject to applicable law, all prospective hires for office based roles or roles that support any of our businesses’ government contracts will be required to demonstrate that they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by their start date, or qualify for a legally-required medical or religious accommodation to this vaccination requirement, as a condition of employment. Hired candidates who do not demonstrate that they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by their start date, and who have not been approved for a legally-required medical or religious accommodation will no longer meet the requirements for employment and their offers of employment will be immediately rescinded, in accordance with applicable law.

Who is Recruiting from Scratch:                Recruiting from Scratch is a premier talent firm that focuses on placing the best product managers, software, and hardware talent at innovative companies. Our team is 100% remote and we work with teams across the United States to help them hire. We work with companies funded by the best investors including Sequoia Capital, Lightspeed Ventures, Tiger Global Management, A16Z, Accel, DFJ, and more.                     About Our Client                   Our client is building an on-ramp to homeownership – one that's more flexible, more affordable, and an all-around better fit for today’s American family and it’s working.            Data Engineering Opportunities:       Our client’s mission to empower home ownership means that they not only buy thousands of homes, but that each of those home purchases must be optimized to fit their current customers’ budgets, and to allow our client the resources to bring more customers into the dream of home ownership.       Their engineering, analytic, and operations teams do amazing work to underwrite customers, generate competitive offers, thoroughly and thoughtfully inspect homes, and to support and service their customers in their new homes. And all of these teams rely on current, complete, diverse, and well-curated data to improve their efficiency and to gain a competitive advantage in our client’s targeted markets. Thus, quality and reliable data provide a key foundation for everything our client does.                    About the Role:       Their business is built upon programmatically making intelligent data-based decisions in every area of our business. They rely heavily on structured data to build financial and risk models, to understand their markets, and to improve their customer services. This requires a strong and very flexible infrastructure that ingests, stores, and retrieves live real estate and related data. In this role, you will help to build their ingestion and ETL pipelines, data lakes, and other key data services to support their engineering and operational divisions.                    You will be able to leverage your adaptability, creativity, and skill set to make homeownership more accessible and equitable. Our client has a small team that is still uncovering critical data sources and applications, so broad, flexible, and proactive thinking is key to their success. You’ll be expected to take ownership of your projects, to support your teammates on other projects, and work collectively to scale their platform to thousands of new applicants and multiple new markets. Almost every project will require cross functional collaboration across the entire home buying process. And you will have the opportunity to work alongside a fantastic team of engineers, product managers, data scientists, and field experts—all of whom are committed to our client's mission, and thirsty for your help in providing that data and tooling to support their passion.                    Responsibilities  :              Ingesting and curating large amounts of heterogeneous real estate and transactional data in batch and real time to create a high quality and accurate data-set.        Quantifying accuracy and uncertainty in our data.        Performing analysis to ensure our datasets are robust and reliable for machine learning        and business use cases.        Working comfortably with data processing technologies (e.g., SQL, Spark, Python,        storage & messaging solutions), with the ability to discern the right tool for the job.        Working to supplement our current data streams to further enrich or data-set (unstructured data such as images, new data providers, integrations, etc.).                         Work Experience             You have multiple years of software development experience        You have experience and an understanding of the entire stack (front-end to database)        You demonstrate a desire for readable, testable, and performant code        You have empathy for your peers and our customers        A deep understanding of data processing technologies such as SQL, Spark, Kafka, etc.        Experience with ETL scheduling technologies                             Benefits:               Competitive salary + equity       Full benefits (medical, dental, vision)       Compassionate and mission focused co-workers       The opportunity to transform the lives of our customers                        Base Salary Range:  $120,000 to $190,000

You’ll function as a working manager, performing and overseeing technical audits to measure and quantify exposures within our business systems, processes, infrastructure, network, and third-party service providers. You’ll play a key role in enterprise-wide efforts by providing IT, security, privacy, and compliance process and control expertise.      Location  Cleveland      Must-have qualifications           Bachelor's degree or higher in Accounting/Finance, Business Mgmt., Economics, Tech-based (computer Science) or Mathematics and a minimum of 9 years’ experience in audit or related professional experience       Required certifications for Financial Auditors: CPA or CIA. For other Audit Jobs: CIA or equivalent(CPA, CISA, and/or Green Belt) required w/24 months pending certification           Preferred skills           IT, privacy, security risk management, audit, and quantification experience, and familiarity with modern technologies, architectures, and Agile development methods.       Experience evaluating controls relative to frameworks such as NIST SP 800-53, ISO 27001/2, and COBIT.       An understanding of State and Federal security and privacy compliance laws.       Experience auditing and assessing risk for technologies/fields such as: Data Science, Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning (ML), Cloud IaaS, PaaS, SaaS Environments (e.g. AWS, Azure, GCP), SDLC, Agile Development practices, Continuous Integration & Delivery (CI/CD), DevSecOps, Microservice Architecture, Containerized Applications and Technology, APIs (e.g. REST)           Compensation           $92,100 - $131,500/year       Gainshare bonus up to 40% of your eligible earnings based on company performance           Benefits           401(k) with dollar-for-dollar company match up to 6%       Medical, dental & vision, including free preventative care       Wellness & mental health programs       Health care flexible spending accounts, health savings accounts, & life insurance       Paid time off       Paid & unpaid sick leave where applicable, as well as short & long-term disability       Parental & family leave; military leave & pay       Diverse, inclusive & welcoming culture with Employee Resource Groups       Career development & tuition assistance           Equal Opportunity Employer                       Job     :  Finance and Accounting                  Primary Location     :  United States-Ohio-Mayfield Village                         Schedule     :  Full-time                  Employee Status     :  Regular                  Work From Home     :  No

Since the year 2000, OEC has grown globally to more than 1,000 employees with a double-digit revenue increase nearly every year. We provide a lively culture, employee rewards and recognition, and the opportunity to develop and implement innovative technology solutions.      Job Summary/Objective   Acts as a subject matter expert and lead on Rebate and dynamic pricing strategies for multiple clients’ B2B business. Supports SaaS product managers in promoting utilization and optimization of multiple ecommerce platforms by clients. Creates insights and programs to drive profitable growth of client’s business, strengthening the value of the client’s relationship with OEC.      This position is 100% remote.      Key Responsibilities & Duties (essential to the job)         Utilizes data science analytics to determine opportunities for market share capture and profitable growth, based on large ecommerce and wholesale sales data,     Uses analytical and problem-solving skills to build models, manipulate data, forecast impact and identify trends for business opportunities for our clients.     Develops reporting and analytics to provide client insight into business performance and opportunity.     Leads ad hoc quantitative deep dives and provides actionable insights to the business.     Designs modern and effective dynamic pricing and rebate schemes that drive client’s profitable growth and priorities.     Develops analysis of rebate programs and dynamic pricing strategies to drive optimization of existing business and capture new business.     Consults with clients on wider pricing strategies and supports the design and implementation of advance pricing strategies.     Listens to clients’ needs and priorities, provides solutions in response and uses business cases to tell a compelling story as to why clients should adopt proposed rebate programs and dynamic pricing strategies.     Partners with the Product and IT teams when developing strategies, processes, and tools to ensure strategies are executable and informed by existing system limitations, restrictions, and marketplace realities.     Assists in the development of a road map for future strategic pricing capabilities and services.     Assists Product Manager in securing new business opportunities by pricing services and creating business cases for potential client proposals.     Engages with internal and external clients to identify, evaluate and quantify pricing and profit opportunities.     Education   A Bachelor’s degree in business, marketing or related field or, in the absence of a degree, equivalent job-related experience.      Experience, Skills and Key Competencies        Essential:          Minimum of 4 years related work experience in pricing, economics, data analytics, and/or statistics     Hands-on experience conceptualizing and developing dynamic pricing and rebate program pricing strategies for new innovative, technology-based products and services and presenting     and creating buy-in by key stakeholders         Previous experience working with B2B sales models and knowledge of B2C environment     Abie to compile and synthesize data from multiple sources to provide customer specific recommendations     Proficient in computer applications including Excel, PowerBI and other analytical tools and software     Strong analytical and interpersonal skills; able to work in partnership and collaboration with     internal and external stake holders         Self-starter with a strong sense of personal accountability and able to manage work quality and meet deadlines     Strong communicator with ability to present complex pricing concepts and guide clients through analytics     Exhibits a proactive problem-solving approach and attitude     Demonstrates inventiveness and creativity in ideating alternative approaches to overcoming     problems and makes recommendations taking into account a number of parameters         Fluent English speaker       Desirable:          Experience working in a SaaS environment and/or the automotive aftersales industry     Proficiency with transforming structured and unstructured data sets     Experience supporting Machine Learning projects     Programming experience in R, Python or SQL     We have updated our Privacy Policy to comply with the new European Union data protection law. job_title: Microsoft - Data & AI - Azure Data Platform Engineer - Senior - Open Location
job_Description: At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.  Tech Consulting, Data Platform Engineer, Senior, US (Azure) EY delivers unparalleled tech consulting services in data strategy, big data engineering, business intelligence, digital, machine learning and Artificial Intelligence. Our clients around the world need your skills with data. We have a reputation of delivering digital initiatives and big ideas with the ambitions to keep doing more. Data is at the forefront of it all. Come help define the future by creating and implementing solutions in the Microsoft ecosystem. The opportunity EY is investing significantly in the build out of Data and AI services that leverage Microsoft Azure. This is a rapidly growing area, and you will have the opportunity to lead and develop your skill set to keep up with the ever-growing demands of the modern data platform and enterprise data fabric landscape, that support data science, business intelligence, artificial intelligence, and cloud applications at scale. You will help our clients with designing and building data and analytics architectures to enable better business outcomes. During implementation, you will collect, aggregate, and analyse structured/unstructured data from multiple internal and external sources, present patterns and insights, and scaling data for use in ML and AI use cases. This is a high growth, high visibility area with plenty of opportunities to enhance your skillset and build your career. Your key responsibilities The Senior Data Engineer (Azure) focuses on implementing solutions and working in client engagement teams to deliver tech consulting services. Skills and attributes for success Collaborating with Cloud Solution Architects in implementing complex end-to-end Enterprise solutions on Microsoft Azure platform. Supporting the strategy, planning, and implementation of data design services, providing sizing and configuration assistance, and performing needs assessments. Developing and maintaining data lake and data warehouse schematics, layouts, architectures and relational/non-relational databases for data access and Advanced Analytics. Excitement to work with customers to understand their overall data estate, IT and business priorities and success measures to design implementation architectures and solutions. Assessing the Customers' knowledge of Azure Data Platform and overall cloud data readiness to support customers through a structured learning plan and ensure its delivery. To qualify for the role, you must have Currently has or is in the process of obtaining their BA/BS or MS degree in Computer Science, Informatics, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Data Science, or Machine Learning. 2+ years of professional consulting experience in business or technology consulting or similar roles. Some understanding of ETL, ELT, data ingestion/cleansing and engineering skills Some exposure and knowledge, in two or more of the following Data Ingestion and Storage. Preferably in Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, Azure SQL, SQL Server Azure Data Lake, Cosmos DB Some Engineering experience and or project course work using large data systems on T-SQL, and/or Python Big Data Analytics. Preferably in Azure Synapse Analytics, Azure Analysis Services, and Snowflake Data Governance, Data Catalog, Master Data Management PowerBI experience is a plus Communication is essential, must be able to listen and understand the question and develop and deliver clear insights. Independent and able to manage and prioritize workload. Ability to adapt quickly and positively to change. A valid driver's license in the US; willingness and ability to travel to meet client needs. Ideally, you'll also have Familiarity with DevOps, CI/CD, Agile and/or Scrum methods of delivery MS Certifications: Azure Data Engineer Associate, Azure Fundamentals What we look for We're interested in passionate leaders with strong vision and a desire to stay on top of trends in the Data and AI industry. We want a customer-focused professional who is motivated to drive the creation of great enterprise products and who can collaborate and partner with other product teams, and engineers. If you have a genuine passion for helping businesses achieve the full potential of their data, this role is for you. MicrosoftFY22 What we offer We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, pension and 401(k) plans, and a wide range of paid time off options. Under our flexible vacation policy, you’ll decide how much vacation time you need based on your own personal circumstances. You’ll also be granted time off for designated EY Paid Holidays, Winter/Summer breaks, Personal/Family Care, and other leaves of absence when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being. Continuous learning:  You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next. Success as defined by you:  We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way. Transformative leadership:  We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs. Diverse and inclusive culture:  You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs. If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible. The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build. EY | Building a better working world EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets. Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate. Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today. EY is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer providing equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other legally protected basis, including arrest and conviction records, in accordance with applicable law. EY is committed to providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability and either need assistance applying online or need to request an accommodation during the interview process, please call 1-800-EY-HELP3, type Option 2 (HR-related inquiries) and then type Option 1 (HR Shared Services Center), which will route you to EY’s Talent Shared Services Team or email SSC Customer Support at ssc.customersupport@ey.com.

Genesys is seeking an experienced and high-energy Account Executive in our Digital Experience team. This is a hybrid role focused on both proactive cultivation of new business as well as targeting and growing existing customer accounts for our digital engagement solution. You will be responsible for creating demand, building qualified opportunity pipeline, up-selling and cross-selling, forecasting and closing bookings as per your assigned plan. You will be responsible for applying a thorough understanding of our products, sales methodology, processes, and prospecting techniques while helping our clients transform their business.   What we expect from you . . .  Align with and model Genesys’ Values:  Embrace Empathy  Fly in Formation  Go Big   The most successful people at Genesys consistently demonstrate these qualities and experiences:  Always Accountable : You commit to be the best at your job and prove it every day, delivering results with integrity, transparency and quality.  Will to Win : You demonstrate urgency and take thoughtful risks, understanding that failing fast is critical to success.  Flexible and Adaptable : You anticipate and plan for potential changes based on competing internal and external demands and do not let shifting priorities frustrate or annoy them.  Passion for Customers : You integrate innovation and quality to fulfill customer needs - the value to customers is the first priority, both internally and externally.  Highly Capable and Innovative : You develop innovative solutions to complex problems, strive for continuous improvement and adapt quickly to changes.   What do you need to have?  Proven experience communicating, negotiating, and closing with executives and stakeholders  Proven experience understanding customer needs and being able to articulate solutions  Increase your pipeline within current customers as well as net new logos 5+ years of sales experience (Digital or SaaS based software sales preferred)  Confirmed ability to lead complex sales cycle, with a track record of successful revenue attainment BS or BA degree or equivalent work-related work experience Ability to travel up to 50%   Benefits  Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance  Paid Parental Leave  Telehealth coverage  Flexible work schedules and work from home opportunities  Development and career growth opportunities  Open Time Off  401(k) matching program  Adoption Assistance  Infertility treatments   See more Genesys benefits information at https://mygenesysbenefits.com/  #LI-JB1  Covid-19:  Safety for our employees and our communities is a key priority for Genesys. With Genesys, organizations have the power to deliver proactive, predictive, and hyper personalized experiences to deepen their customer connection across every marketing, sales, and service moment on any channel, while also improving employee productivity and engagement. By transforming back-office technology to a modern revenue velocity engine Genesys enables true intimacy at scale to foster customer trust and loyalty. Emerging ERP Solutions - Senior Manager          As a Workday Sr Manager at Deloitte, you will join an organization that has a sixteen year relationship with Workday leadership and more than nine years as a Global Alliance Partner. Our Emerging ERP Solutions team focuses on implementing cloud-based ERP and EPM applications such as Workday Financials & Adaptive Insights. This unique mix of technologies differentiate themselves from on-premise / cloud applications such as SAP and Oracle.                           Work you'll do          Responsibilities will include:            Client Management: Manage day to day interactions with executive clients and sponsors      Delivery: Manage and deliver components of client engagements that identify, design, and implement technology and creative business solutions for large companies. Responsibilities include, among others, managing teams in the identification of business requirements, functional design, process design (including scenario design, flow mapping), prototyping, testing, training, defining support procedures.      Business Development: Develop and maintain contact with top decision makers at key clients; organize and lead pursuit teams; participate and lead aspects of the proposal development process; contribute to the development of proposal pricing strategies.      People Development: Perform role of counselor and coach; provide input and guidance into the staffing process; actively participate in staff recruitment and retention activities; provide leadership and support for delivery teams and staff in local offices.                 Qualifications          Required:         Senior Manager Workday/Adaptive Insights are required to have:            10+ years of relevant consulting or industry experience      4+ years' experience overseeing multiple project teams      Experience with Workday/Adaptive Insights and/or other leading Cloud based SaaS EPM applications (e.g. Anaplan, Oracle Hyperion, SAP BPC, Cognos TM1, Host, Prophix, OneStream, etc.)      Hands-on functional FP&A and Management Reporting knowledge - Budgeting, Accounting, Financial and Management Reporting, and Workforce Planning      Travel up to 50% (While 50% of travel is a requirement of the role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice).      Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future, or limited sponsorship may be available.                Bachelor's Degree or equivalent professional experience         Preferred:            Senior experience with a market leading consulting organization      Workday Adaptive Insights certification      Proven skills as a project manager on multiple full life cycle implementations.      Understanding and knowledge of financial applications, architectures, general knowledge of trends with leading and emerging financial technology vendors and solutions      Demonstrated knowledge or interest in emerging digital technologies shown through either knowledge, experience or academic exposure, including Cognitive, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Robotic Process Automation (RPA), Natural Language Processing, Visualizations, and Predictive Analytics      Adept at implementing technology-enabled business solutions for clients.      Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills with the ability to exercise mature judgment.      Ability to engage and manage senior-level client relationships      Strong oral and written communication skills, including presentation skills (MS Visio, MS PowerPoint).      Willingness to mentor junior staff.

job_title: Senior Consultant, Senior Paid Social Media Buyer
job_Description: Position Summary         In today's world, customers expect companies to know who they are and what they want. Customers want to have products, services, or experiences that best suit their needs delivered to them seamlessly across physical and digital channels. Customers are human first: driven by dynamic wants, needs, and desires. The ability for brands to make personal, meaningful connections on a human level has never been greater and the Experience Management team at Deloitte Digital delivers on those experiences in a way that allows companies to own the customer journey end-to-end.         We help companies connect key data sources to understand what matters most to people; connect to advanced technologies like AI and machine learning to sense and respond to those needs at scale; and connect their systems to unlock insights, create collaboration and drive acquisition, engagement, and loyalty. Most importantly, we empower companies to connect with customers in personal, meaningful ways that respect them as people, not just customers.        The Experience Management team at Deloitte Digital gives companies the ability to build and leverage the connections - between people, systems, data, and technologies - so they can deliver personalized, contextual experiences to customers at scale. We are seeking to transform the way brands interact with their customers and elevate the human experience. Do you have data in your DNA? Join our growing team in supporting our clients' ability to communicate the right message to the right customers at the right time.           The Work You'll do         We are seeking a strong candidate that is passionate about social paid media, teamwork, process improvement, and driving results for clients. Attention to detail, positive energy, and a willingness to learn should be engrained in your DNA. You have a knack for digging into data and problem-solving your way to ROAS positive campaigns.        The Senior Paid Social Media Buyer will work across Deloitte Digital Clients, report to the Head of Ad Performance, and work as part of our Paid Media team. This person will be responsible for building and optimizing Facebook, LinkedIn, Pinterest, TikTok, and other paid social campaigns with the goal of achieving, and in many cases, exceeding clients' objectives and KPIs. The ideal candidate has a strong paid social planning, buying, and analysis background with experience executing/buying on social platforms. Additionally, you are looking to help mentor and up-level members of your team.            Build, manage and optimize paid social media campaigns through a variety of social platforms, specifically Facebook Ads Manager, TikTok, and YouTube (Pinterest and LinkedIn are a plus)      Develop paid social strategy to meet and exceed client's KPIs.      Utilize reporting to measure, evaluate, and analyze paid social campaign performance to determine campaign success and provide recommendations and optimizations on an ongoing basis.      Actively test and analyze targeting, ad creative, landing pages, and placements to drive results      Manage and pace campaign budgets on a routine basis to ensure efficient delivery of advertising spend and to ensure clients are pacing towards campaign objectives and goals      Work cross-functionally to align campaign strategies and goals across the paid media team in an effort to create more collaboration and ensure a holistic paid media approach and strategy      Create and present quarterly business reviews & other client-facing presentations that outline performance, insights from testing, and key strategic opportunities      Measure impact and effectiveness of campaigns and share results and insights with the paid media director and client contact      Stay current on paid social industry trends and emerging platforms      Delegate work to a paid social analyst who will support you on the account            The team         Advertising, Marketing & Commerce         Our Advertising, Marketing & Commerce team focuses on delivering marketing and growth objectives aligned with our clients' brand values for measurable business growth. We do this by creating content, communications, and experiences that engage and inspire their customers to act. We implement and operate the technology platforms that enable personalized content, commerce, and marketing user-centric experiences. In doing so, we transform our clients' marketing and engagement operations into modern, data-driven, creatively focused organizations. Our team brings deep experience in creative and digital marketing capabilities, many from our Digital Studios.        We serve our clients through the following types of work:            Omnichannel customer engagement strategy, design, and development (web, mobile, social, physical)      eCommerce strategy, implementation, and operations      Marketing Content and digital asset management solutions      Marketing Technology and Advertising Technology solutions      Marketing analytics implementation and operations      Advertising campaign ideation, development, and execution      Acquisition and engagement campaign ideation, development, and execution      Agile based, design-thinking, user-centric, empirical projects that accelerate results            Required Qualifications             4+ years of experience in paid social media buying and analysis      Experience in Facebook Ads Manager      In-depth knowledge of social media content requirements, restrictions, and best practices by platform - includes buying, optimizing, and reporting practices      Able to review results and performance of paid media campaigns based on predetermined success indicators, determine the effectiveness and report back to clients      Must be organized and able to work under multiple deadlines      Ability to collaborate in a team environment with a demonstrated ability to assist where needed      Willingness to dive in and find answers to complex problems where solutions may not yet be documented      Strong interpersonal and communication skills      Strong analytical and problem-solving skills      Initiative, detail orientation, strong analytical and decision-making skills      Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications      Bachelor of Arts or Bachelor of Science degree      Travel up to 30% (while 30% of travel is a requirement of the role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice)      Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship now or at any time in the future            Preferred Qualifications             Facebook Blueprint certifications in Media Planning, Buying, etc.      Experience in the women's retail industry      Advertising Agency experience        AMC2021        XMAMC2022

Senior or Lead IT Auditor               Job Number     :      190643               As a  senior or lead information technology auditor,  you’ll support the growing need for Information Technology, security, data privacy risk, and control assessments. Using your exceptional problem-solving skills, you’ll participate in technical audits to measure and quantify exposures within our business systems, processes, infrastructure, network, and third-party service providers. You’ll assist with audit planning, control identification, and testing, and will work with IT Audit Management to provide IT, security, privacy, and compliance process and control expertise across multiple areas, so you’ll need the ability to understand technology and how to leverage it appropriately. This position offers an exciting opportunity to drive control assurance through involvement with high priority IT and business areas, and critical projects across the company.      Location  Cleveland     Must-have qualifications           Bachelor's degree in accounting/finance, technology-based or mathematics       Four years of work experience in a corporate information technology setting       CISA (Certified Information Systems Auditor) or equivalent certification required within 24 months           Preferred skills           Information Technology, privacy, security risk management, audit, and quantification experience, project management experience, and familiarity with modern technologies, architectures, and iterative development methods       Experience evaluating controls relative to frameworks such as NIST SP 800-53, ISO 27001/2, and COBIT       Understanding of State and Federal security and privacy compliance laws       Experience and knowledge of auditing and assessing risk in areas such as:              Data Science, Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning (ML)         Cloud IaaS, PaaS, SaaS Environments (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP)         SDLC, Agile Development practices, Continuous Integration & Delivery (CI/CD), DevSecOps         Microservice Architecture, Containerized Applications and Technology, REST APIs         Experience with SOC1 / SOC2 assessments             Novice knowledge of ACL (Audit Control Language) and the other Microsoft Office tools (Word, PowerPoint, Excel, and Visio)           Compensation           $78,700 – 109,900/year       Gainshare bonus up to 30% of your eligible earnings based on company performance           Benefits           401(k) with dollar-for-dollar company match up to 6%       Medical, dental & vision, including free preventative care       Wellness & mental health programs       Health care flexible spending accounts, health savings accounts, & life insurance       Paid time off       Paid & unpaid sick leave where applicable, as well as short & long-term disability       Parental & family leave; military leave & pay       Diverse, inclusive & welcoming culture with Employee Resource Groups       Career development & tuition assistance           Equal Opportunity Employer                       Job     :  Finance and Accounting                  Primary Location     :  United States-Ohio-Mayfield Village                         Schedule     :  Full-time                  Employee Status     :  Regular                  Work From Home     :  Yes

What makes us Qlik     Qlik helps enterprises around the world move faster, work smarter, and lead the way forward with an end-to-end solution for getting value out of data. A Gartner Magic Quadrant Leader for 12 years in a row! Our platform is the only one on the market that allows for open-ended, curiosity-driven exploration, giving everyone – at any skill level – the ability to make real discoveries that lead to real outcomes and transformative changes. We are a Values-Driven organization, operating over 100 countries with 38,000 customers around the world. If you think we are interesting, please read on – we may be looking for you!     The OEM Organization/Team  As a part of the Qlik sales team, you will build and manage OEM Partnerships in the region while carrying an annual target quota. This job will create the process for engaging and managing such partners and be responsible for a revenue number from these partnerships. This will include managing a sales cycle from start to finish, selling the broad scope of Qlik’s platform and applications across data integration, data analytics, automation, machine learning, and professional services offerings. You will be responsible for managing current relationships and focusing on winning new business with strong emphasis on net new        The OEM Enterprise Sales Role     As our next OEM Enterprise Sales Rep, you will:         Fully own, Target, engage, sign, enable and manage potential OEM Software companies, Data Providers, ioT providers, MSP’s and hardware device companies.      Manage the full sales cycle, across all use cases, while carrying a target quota.      Build, approach, plan and acquisition strategy for each to deliver sales targets and maximum customer satisfaction across the full use cases – internal use, external and all Qlik products – Analytics, Data Integration, SaaS.      Identify & target <75 top named prospects; with corporate annual revenue of $100M+.      Provide guidance to Partner prospects throughout the acquisition process; including technical and business due diligence, contract negotiations to closure      Collaborate with the Partner to build the mutual business plan and go to market strategy Coordinate Partner training (sales and technical), product launch, onboarding, and revenue production.      Attend joint sales calls with Partner when appropriate Prepare and execute “Seeing is Believing” (SIB) events      Build a sustainable pipeline with each Partner with regular reviews to maintain cadence, expectations and deliver results      Participation in trade show events, workshops, seminars, and other marketing events Responsible for attaining/exceeding annual quota      Travel may be required; Central US coverage.        Skills and qualifications required for this role include:         Experience in selling solutions and concepts to senior decision makers, especially product management, finance, executive, sales and marketing      A sense of urgency and enthusiasm in a team environment. Leverage team resources in technical pre-sales, consulting, technical account management and marketing to achieve results.      Ability to qualify and prioritize prospects, and generate opportunities through prospecting, networking and relationship building      Strong communication and negotiation skills and ability to articulate business value differentiation      The ability to be a creative thinker with the ability to multi-task.      The ability to receive and assimilate constructive management coaching      An outgoing, focused and organized approach with a strong will to succeed      Experience taking deals from lead to closure to product launch.      Experience managing complex sales, using existing sales methodologies, customer centric selling into matrixed organizations.      An understanding of how to create pricing proposals with experience in revenue recognition, subscription and royalty structures.      The ability to create simplified pricing proposals that match customer needs and complex go-to-market situations.      Be prime Partner contact throughout the acquisition process through post acquisition and revenue based activities. Work together with customer success teams and services organizations.      Achieve the required quantity and quality of outbound calls to OEM prospects to qualify and convert enough new business to meet a monthly quota as set by Qlik management.      Generate sales opportunities by cold/warm calling current and prospective customers      Provide guidance to Partner prospects throughout the acquisition process; including technical and business due diligence, contract negotiations to closure      Collaborate with the Partner to build the mutual business plan and go to market strategy including product launch, onboarding and revenue production.      Attend joint sales calls with Partner when appropriate.      Provide pricing, proposals and order management over the phone and through email. Utilize phone, email and web tools to communicate and present company offerings.      Forecast and track deals, manage opportunity and account plans, grow your network, evangelize, and present to management on regular basis.      Work with other OEM Account Managers to ensure success.      Responsible for attaining/exceeding annual quota      7+ years of successful enterprise sales experience in software (technology) solutions sales and account management – strategy, goal setting, consistent performance and results.      Proven abilities to deliver sales results, combined with a passion for tackling tough challenges and being rewarded for results.      OEM and customer’s customer usage specific sales experience is a plus      Knowledge of development licenses, SaaS infrastructure, royalties, pre-payment methods, training and services pricing structures required.      Understanding of Business Intelligence, reporting and dashboards.      Must have excellent PPT and presentation skills, be a self-starter and able to work independently within a matrixed organization. Use of Salesforce.com experience desired.      Ability to intelligently utilize Solution Architects to discover technical requirements, present feature set solution aligned with customer needs, and articulate technical and business differentiation throughout the sales process.      A Bachelor equivalent mandatory. Advanced Degree preferred.           The location for this role is/are:         Remote Midwest, United States:            Illinois        Wisconsin        Ohio        Indiana        Minnesota              About Qlik         Qlik Company Page – Who we are!       Our Values at Qlik: Challenge, Take Responsibility, Move Fast, Teamwork for Results, Be Open and Straightforward      Competitive Benefits package      Flexible working environment      Giving back is a part of our culture – we give you a day to change the world. In addition, we encourage our employees to participate in our Corporate Responsibility Employee Programs      Learn about our Corporate Responsibility Program by visiting org      Check out our careers in R&D here.      Check out our company page on Linkedin!      Follow us on Instagram @lifeatqlik and @Qlik      Check us out on the muse! See employee testimonials!      Check us out on Youtube!        Proof of full vaccination against COVID-19 will be required as a condition of employment in the US. If you receive an offer and are unable to get vaccinated for religious or medical reasons, you may request a reasonable accommodation prior to commencing employment. Overview of Position The Senior Product Manager of Assurant Data Analytics COE is responsible for day-to-day execution of the assigned key strategic product/projects for the internal Assurant line of business partners and external clients. The product/project is focused on building Analytics as a Product (AaaP) and plans/manages product features through the product development process in support of the overall line of business strategy with data analytics features and functions (including machine learning and data science products) and integrating them into the line of business processes to improve operational efficiency and business value. This is a cross-functional role that uses business acumen, data/analytics, user experience, customer feedback, vendor tools and technology to create seamless customer experience. What will be my duties and responsibilities in this job? Product Leadership (50%) Act as product owner and drive Analytics as a Product (AaaP) structure & process and provide thought leadership to Assurant’s Data Analytics COE, questioning traditional wisdom, current standard practices, and capabilities. Develop, manage, maintain and communicate the product (AaaP) development roadmap Work cross-functionally with business owners to develop innovative data analytics products that will increase customer experience, capitalize growth opportunities, deliver competitive advantage and improve decision making. Drive execution with the product team, ensuring that everyone is working towards the same goals and impact. Act as subject matter expert internally on the AaaP process and platform. Own ongoing support for product materials (including training documentation, wiki pages and product guides etc.). Strong team player who can proactively partner across teams to identify and solve organizational challenges/opportunities. Communicating Insights (25%) Provides feedback to data analytics and engineering teams on product design (including ML and non-ML solutions), development and communicate the approach and implementation of the ML and non-ML solutions. Understand the “why” behind the product features and functions and work with senior management to understand the roadmap, supporting KPIs and can clearly communicate to their product development teams. Leverages data to present compelling business cases to optimize investments and operations. Presents analysis and resulting recommendations to business and senior management team. Communicates and educates both technical and non-technical employees on analytics and data-driven decision making. Project Management (15%) Leads projects and assists in development of project plans, business understanding, business validation, hypothesis testing, presenting complex information for various audiences in simplified terms, and identifying next steps and future opportunity. Mentors team members in product management proficiency, analytics storytelling, business acumen and cross-functional agile delivery. Collaborates with team members to prioritize requests requiring multiple resources for thorough project completion within stated timelines. Support Data Strategies (10%) Remains abreast of developments in the field(s) of insurance, management, and data analytics by attending self-development programs, interacting with peers, and reviewing pertinent literature. Incorporates advancements when practicable and cost effective. Participate and drive data modeling and governance best practices. Proactively engages internal and external teams to discover areas of analytical needs. Advances company-wide understanding and implementation of AI and machine learning as well as matures the team’s practices and procedures, leveraging learnings from existing implementations. Participates in the talent acquisition process by screening and interviewing candidates at all levels. What are the requirements needed for this position? 8+ years - Experience in product management, business analysis, research, statistics, applied mathematics, data management, business intelligence, or related fields. 8+ years - Experience in data analysis that includes translating insights into recommendations. 8+ years – Experience in strategy and/or analytics product design & delivery experience in executing world-class analytics products. 4+ years - Leading analytical projects. 4+ years - Experience with data science development lifecycle (CRISP-DM) and/or an agile software environment (SDLC). 2+ years’ demonstrated delivery of business results. Demonstrated experience working cross-functionally in a large organization. Demonstrated experience working closely with senior leadership. Demonstrated ability to translate data into quantifiable actions/deliverable. Master’s Degree in Business, Marketing, Engineering, Communications, Economics, Computer Science, or Information Management; or equivalent is required. What other skills/experience would be helpful to have? Master’s Degree preferred in business, mathematics, computer science, or related field. Prior product management experience with insurance domain. Experience working with Data Analytics teams highly preferred. Strong written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills. Ability to effectively communicate at all levels in the organization. Experience with data storytelling and distilling complex information into understandable ideas. Experience working in insurance industry. Ability to provide innovative approach to problem solving and demonstrate a track record of such. Possesses strong analytical and research skills. Ability to work independently on all project types. Exposure with cloud technologies (e.g. Apache Spark, Azure (Databricks, Azure ML, Cognitive Services)). Ability to lead and motivate employees that may or may not be direct reports.

We are:  CFO-Enterprise Value, and we give finance execs the sounding board they need. Value isn’t just about maintenance. It’s about zeroing in on smart, sustainable ways to grow, and finding the right tools to keep everything on track. We’ve got the deep industry experience, the functional insights, the data power, and the digital tech leadership to help our clients make important changes. Whether we’re breaking down meaningful analytics, designing the perfect finance platforms, or building from current risk and compliance models to get ready for the future, we solve our clients’ toughest problems. Visit us here to find out more about CFO-Enterprise Value.     You are:     An experienced Finance professional with a strong background in FP&A and a deep understanding of the FP&A Processes. You get excited about solving complex problems and finding new solutions for clients. Digital Finance professionals support clients in developing Finance Organization Strategies, Optimizing FP&A processes all by leveraging Performance Management technology capabilities to support our clients’ long-term growth. You’ve managed large teams, love big challenges, and are ready for a new one. You are skilled at building trusted relationships within your own organization, with clients, and with ecosystem partners.        The work:         Lead transformation initiatives in FP&A areas      Create strategies and blueprints that improve operations and refine processes       Involved in setting strategic direction to establish near term goals for area of responsibility      Interacts with senior management levels at a client and/or within Accenture, which involves negotiating or influencing on significant matters      Has latitude in decision-making and determining objectives and approaches to critical assignments. Decisions have a lasting impact on area of responsibility with the potential to impact outside area of responsibility      Manages large teams and/or work efforts (if in an individual contributor role) at a client or within Accenture      Help clients modernize their FP&A process by consulting with internal and external teams to understand strategy and goals, then managing teams to execute      Attract new business by creating thoughtful proposals and building strong client relationships      Serve as a trusted advisor to senior leadership      Stay on top of current regulations, trends, and technologies influencing digital finance, analytics, and the CFO ecosystem      Provide recommendations based on FP&A leading practices           Travel:     For now, all Accenture business travel, international and domestic, is currently restricted to client-essential sales/delivery activity only.     Please note: The safety and well-being of our people continues to be the top priority, and our decisions around travel are informed by government COVID-19 response directives, recommendations from leading health authorities and guidance from a number of infectious disease experts.              Job Qualifications     Here’s what you need:         Bachelor’s Degree in finance and/or accounting      Strong analytical and problem-solving skills      A minimum of 8 years working in FP&A, preferably with a Big Four public accounting firm      Minimum of 5 years of experience leading/managing large teams      Minimum of 8 years of demonstrated operational experience with one or more of the following:      Finance and Accounting Processes & Functions (i.e. General Accounting, Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, Fixed Assets)      Financial Planning and Analysis (Budgeting, Planning, Forecasting or Management Reporting)      Financial process and/or system program management responsibilities      Management of a finance team function      Management reporting & operational or balance score carding      Solid understanding of the underlying finance and accounting processes and leading practices      Finance Transformation (Planning, Financial Reporting, General Accounting, AP, AR, EPM, Program/Project Management, Change Management, Financial Systems Integration)      Financial Process automation, standardization, organizational consolidation (e.g. Creating, Defining Finance Centers of Excellence, automating processes through robotics or applied intelligence, machine learning)      Reporting and analytics including visualizations                 A minimum of 6 years of relevant experience in implementing Finance technologies. This may include, but not limited to data, planning, budgeting, analytics, reporting and enabling technologies       Deep functional understanding of FP&A processes including Capabilities Driver based , Predictive forecasting, rolling forecast, scenario planning, Cost allocations, Zero based budgeting and Management reporting       Solid project management experience including defining scope, setting project timelines and milestone, driving deliverables, identifying risks, managing issues, and client relationship management       Proven success in contributing to a team-oriented environment, client experience preferred       Excellent leadership, communication (written and oral) and interpersonal skills       Ability to effectively engage with senior-level client executives       Proven track record in driving business outcomes for large clients/stakeholders       Ability to effectively develop, mentor, advise, and coach teams              Bonus points if:           You’ve got an MBA after your name or another type of advanced degree       FP&A Enabling Technologies (Board, OneStream, Anaplan, Cognos, SAP SAC, SAP BPC, SAP Group Reporting, Oracle Hyperion, Oracle EPM Cloud, Tableau, Workday - Adaptive Insights)       Emerging Finance Enabling Technologies (Robotic Process Automation technology, Artificial / Applied Intelligence technologies in Finance / Accounting       You have led 4-5 full implementation of FP&A solutions       You have a least 4 year designing these FinTech solutions: OneStream, Anaplan, Cognos, Hyperion, OBIEE, Tableau, and Fusion.       Certification in any of the Fin Tech Solutions mentioned. As part of a very dynamic team, you will play a critical role in envisioning and developing comprehensive solutions as part of our Product strategy. You will work in a high-energy, fun, and engaging work environment with talented colleagues from diverse backgrounds and experiences. This is a remote opportunity with the ability to work anywhere within the United States. Design end-to-end solutions using Automation Anywhere best practices and maintain technical responsibility for project delivery. Manage project expectations as well as participate in software development, continuous deliverance of progress reports, requirements documentation, and presentations. Serves as the chief technical resource and helps define appropriate client support responses, as well as dealing directly with customers on high-level critical issues. Provide technical leadership and contribute to distributed, cross-institutional open-source software application architecture and design teams. Develop strong relationships with potential and existing clients to ensure longevity and further business. Experience in the business technology market, and expertise working closely with pre-sales and marketing teams Travel: 50-75% (when safely able to do so) You will be a great fit if you have: Bachelor’s required in Computer Science, Data Analytics, Data Science or other forms of Engineering, Master’s preferred At least 7+ years relevant experience in a technical role such as Software Engineering, Solutions Architecture, Technical Product Management, etc. Prior experience with RPA platforms such as Automation Anywhere, UiPath, Blue Prism, Workfusion, etc. Successful implementation of at least 1 IQ Bot project on v11 or A360 recommended Experience training documents with IQ Bot, Pre Processing, and Post Processing techniques and best practices Experience in object-oriented programming (C#, C++, JavaScript, Java, PowerShell, or Python preferred) and Shell/Batch/VB scripting (Linux, Windows). .NET 3.5 and higher Framework (C++, ASP.NET, ADO.NET, Entity Framework or Hibernate Strong knowledge and experience in SDLC process including solutions design, best practices, application design, development, troubleshooting, and maintenance. Strong knowledge of machine learning project lifecycle, identifying data, curation, training, optimization of models is a must. Experience with implanting various machine learning platforms such as computer vision and NLP-based cognitive solutions especially ones involving classification or extraction models is a plus. Databases such as SQL Server is a must. Fluency in SQL Joins and other DB best practices. Knowledge is Stored in procedures, server architecture. Deploying applications in AWS, Azure infrastructure, knowledge of CloudFormation or terraform scripting. CI/CD architecture preferred with exposure to Jenkins, CircleCI Ability to create technical workflows architecture diagrams and implementation-related documentation. Thorough understanding of various system architecture, Window/Unix based server application deployment, including knowledge on High Availability on-premise/cloud-based delivery models. TCIP/SFTP and port allocation/status messages. Experience with Agile Development and Scrum methodology. (CSM/CSD recommended) You excel in these key competencies:  Solid presentation and communication skills and ability to effectively communicate complex technical concepts to a broad range of audiences. Client-facing experience, ability to interact with C-level executives, and handle a high level of communication. Strong track record of working collaboratively with software engineering to develop and deploy systems. Why Automation Anywhere? At our company, each person brings their unique talents to work as a team and make a difference. As the leader in Robotic Process Automation (RPA), we provide a very compelling product where our teams are breaking new ground every day and given an environment to grow their skills and have fun along the way. Our technology is the game-changer, and our people give us the edge to better our world and go be great!
